abstract: Federal Bureau of Investigation Director James B Comey publicly defends law enforcement policies he executed as federal prosecutor during 1980s and 1990s, diverging from prevailing view of Obama administration that such policies have led to mass incarceration; remarks fuel tensions between Comey and Justice Dept, and irritate White House, caught by surprise by speech that effectively undermines administration's efforts at criminal justice reform.
lead_paragraph: Mr. Comey, going against the custom of his job, has spoken out against some of his past law-enforcement tactics being characterized as “mass incarceration.”

headline.main: James B. Comey, Unlike Other F.B.I. Directors, Takes On Controversial Issues
headline.print_headline: F.B.I. Director, Defending Legacy, Lets Chips Fall Where They May
